talk.author: did:plc:usl4pnhyasr2moto7elbvhw6
talk.utter: Bluesky PBC builds the Authenticated Transfer Protocol, or ATProto for short. It is a decentralised protocol, and it is not supposed to put any kind of information into the control of one entity.

talk.author: did:plc:usl4pnhyasr2moto7elbvhw6
talk.utter: A "checkmark system" would not only centralise this information at Bluesky PBC, but also add them as someone you have to trust. Domain Name Verification is a form of self-verification that was implemented specifically because you don't have to trust Bluesky.

talk.author: did:plc:usl4pnhyasr2moto7elbvhw6
talk.utter: It cuts out Bluesky as a central authority over who is/isn't what they say and leaves that for the existing internet infrastructure that we have built, expanding on open standards that we've already established.

talk.author: did:plc:usl4pnhyasr2moto7elbvhw6
talk.utter: All of this goes hand in hand with the idea that the Network should outlive Bluesky as a company. They build with the idea that Bluesky PBC might not live on forever in mind.
